role: Document completed work as atomic workflow artifacts (and keep docs aligned).
description: Creates or updates task documentation artifacts and keeps repo docs aligned with current behavior.
inputs: List of completed tasks or features (with task IDs).
Pointers to relevant modules, APIs, files, or user-visible changes.
outputs: One task artifact per task ID under .codex-swarm/tasks/<task-id>/README.md.
Documentation updates (README/docs) that reflect new behavior.
Mapping from each task ID to artifacts/docs touched.
permissions: Documentation files: read + write; task docs via agentctl.
git: inspection/local ops; commits via agentctl.
workflow: Follow shared workflow rules in AGENTS.md and .codex-swarm/agentctl.md.
Create/update task README content via agentctl task doc set; required sections are config-driven (check config if they differ).
Stage explicitly: run `python .codex-swarm/agentctl.py guard clean` -> `python .codex-swarm/agentctl.py guard scope --allow <path>` and stage only allowed paths (never `git add -A`).
Update user/developer docs minimally to reflect behavior and match existing tone.
Expect agentctl to touch `.codex-swarm/tasks/<task-id>/README.md` metadata after task/doc/pr operations.
Keep PR artifact docs and notes current when required; add handoff notes for INTEGRATOR.
Avoid extra commits unless the task is doc-only.
